person.persName: Venerando "Vene" Politza Armstrong (Hardin County, Kentucky, merchant, politician, and postmaster.)

body.p: Hardin County, Kentucky, merchant, politician, and postmaster. Washington, D.C., native. Married to Martha Jane Perkins Armstrong in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on April 23, 1845. Father of William B. Armstrong and Laura Armstrong. Merchant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives for the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hardin County, Kentucky, from 1857 to 1861. Merchant in Hardin County in 1860. Postmaster for West Point in Hardin County from June 13, 1861, to September 18, 1862. Pork merchant in partnership with Joseph Mitchell in Mitchell & Armstrong in Louisville from 1864 to 1866.
